subject: JUnit refactorings (was: Proposed parameterized test syntax for JUnit 4)
msgSnippet: ... Extract Class would be cool to have.  As a general refactoring, it s not quite the same thing as what we want for JUnit tests, however.  What we want is
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> Elliotte Harold wrote:
> > Or perhaps what we need is some nice Eclipse refactorings that move test
> > methods into new classes.
>
> Extract Class! Absolutely we need it.

Extract Class would be cool to have. As a general refactoring, it's not
quite the same thing as what we want for JUnit tests, however. What we
want is for Eclipse to understand test fixtures, test methods, and
setUp. For example, if we extract SecondTest from FirstTest, and they
share no fixtures, neither need reference the other at all. For general
Java classes, you'd want to Extract Superclass and then Replace
Inheritance with Delegation (neither of which Eclipse really has,
unfortunately). The refactoring I've wanted most is Replace Query with
Fixture. For example, from:

public void testA() {
Component comp = new Component(5);
assertEquals(6, comp.successor());
}

public void testB() {
Component comp = new Component(5);
assertEquals(4, comp.predecessor());
}

I can automatically Extract Method to get:


public void testA() {
Component comp = theComponent();
assertEquals(6, comp.successor());
}

public void testB() {
Component comp = theComponent();
assertEquals(4, comp.predecessor());
}

private Component theComponent() {
return new Component(5);
}

But I want the next step automatically, as well:

public void setUp() {
Component fComp = new Component(5);
}

public void testA() {
assertEquals(6, fComp.successor());
}

public void testB() {
assertEquals(4, fComp.predecessor());
}

Anyone else had this desire?
